Rich,
I'm not sure if he was the originator of the term, but Mr. Sasano seemed to be the main proponent of the idea of Ko-Umetada.  I haven't found much (any?) support for the idea in Japan these days.  I have a guard here:

 http://home.earthlink.net/~jggilbert/heianjo.htm

second to last on the page, that Sasano-sensei attributed to late Muromachi Ko-Umetada, but I don't think that a kanteisho in agreement with that could be had today.

Jim



  Jim and all -

  Been doing some looking thru catalogs, references,etc.
  Any possibility of this being a so-called Ko-Umetada piece??
  It's vaguely similar to one in Haynes #7 that he calls
  ko-Umetada (but then says there is really no such thing :-)
  which I don't understand at all).

  Rich S
